paragraphs.text:
%md

Here, we create a SVM model for dataset wine also, but in R

# Import libraries

msg.data:
Here, we create a SVM model for dataset wine also, but in R

Import libraries

paragraphs.text:
%r
install.packages("e1071")
install.packages("XML")
install.packages("pmml")
install.packages("caTools")

%md
If after doing install.packages, it still can't find the library, we need to install the library by using %sh like below (to see the errors)

msg.data: If after doing install.packages, it still can’t find the library, we need to install the library by using %sh like below (to see the errors)

paragraphs.text:
/*
%sh
R -e "install.packages('e1071', repos = 'http://cran.us.r-project.org', dependencies=TRUE)"
*/

paragraphs.text:
%r
library(e1071)
library(caTools)
library(pmml)
library(XML)

%md
# Load data from HDFS

Here, we use dataset wine.csv that contains chemical analysis of wines grown in the same region in Italy but derived from two different cultivars. This is a sample from dataset wine.data from UCI https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/wine

msg.data:
Load data from HDFS

Here, we use dataset wine.csv that contains chemical analysis of wines grown in the same region in Italy but derived from two different cultivars. This is a sample from dataset wine.data from UCI https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/wine

paragraphs.text:
%r
# URI of HDFS
uri <- 'http://hupi-factory-02-01-01.factory02.viet.cloud-torus.com:8020/user/factory02/formation_hupi/wine.csv?op=OPEN'

%r
# Read data from HDFS
data = read.csv(uri)

msg.data: Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection to 'http://hupi-factory-02-01-01.factory02.viet.cloud-torus.com:8020/user/factory02/formation_hupi/wine.csv?op=OPEN'

paragraphs.text:
%r
head(data)

%r
str(data)

%md
# Transform data

We need to transform data. Firstly, the column of variable to predict must be converted from int to factor

msg.data:
Transform data

We need to transform data. Firstly, the column of variable to predict must be converted from int to factor

paragraphs.text:
%r
# Convert X1 to factor
data$X1 = as.factor(data$X1)

%r
str(data)

%r
# Number of observations
n <- nrow(data)
print(n)

%md
# Split data in train and test set

msg.data: Split data in train and test set

paragraphs.text:
%r
# We divide data to train set and test set 
sample = sample.split(data, SplitRatio = .7)
train = subset(data, sample == TRUE)
test  = subset(data, sample == FALSE)

%r
# Count number of observations in train and test set
nrow(train)
nrow(test)

%md
# Build SVM model

%r
# we build SVM Model for classification with kernal radial, here we try with gamma = 0.1 and cost = 0.5
svm1 <- svm(X1~., data=train, 
          method="C-classification", kernal="radial", 
          gamma=0.1, cost=0.5)

%r
# Summary of model
summary(svm1)

msg.data:
Call:
svm(formula = X1 ~ ., data = train, method = “C-classification”, 
    kernal = “radial”, gamma = 0.1, cost = 0.5)

Parameters:
   SVM-Type:  C-classification 
 SVM-Kernel:  radial 
       cost:  0.5 

Number of Support Vectors:  51

( 22 29 )

Number of Classes:  2 

Levels: 
 1 2

paragraphs.text:
%r
# Support vectors of model
svm1$SV

%md
# Test model

%r
prediction <- predict(svm1, test)

%r
xtab <- table(test$X1, prediction)
xtab

%r
# Accuracy of model
accuracy = (21+25) / nrow(test)
accuracy

%md
Our model is veryyy good :) It can predict 100% data in test set

msg.data: Our model is veryyy good :) It can predict 100% data in test set

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Convert to PMML format
We can convert model in R to PMML format

msg.data:
Convert to PMML format

We can convert model in R to PMML format

paragraphs.text:
%r
# create a pmml 
svm.pmml = pmml(svm1, data = data[, -c(1)])

%r
# Save pmml model to local
saveXML(svm.pmml,"svm.pmml")

%sh
# We print what we have : we see the svm.pmml that we just saved
ls

cat svm.pmml
